abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the project were as
            follows: the outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability
            was likely, the institutional development impact was
            substantial, and the Bank and borrower performance were both
            satisfactory,. There are at least five key lessons to be
            derived from the design and implementation of the AIDS and
            Sexually Transmitted Disease Control Project (LUSIDA)
            project: (a) Ensuring up-front political support and
            commitment for important, and often politically difficult,
            HIV/AIDS policy changes is crucial to effectively address
            the HIV/AIDS epidemic; (b) Involving NGOs during project
            preparation is necessary to ensure buy-in from civil society
            as main actors in project implementation and to ensure
            accountability of policy makers in HIV/AIDS prevention
            policy; (c) Reaching clear agreements and setting effective
            monitoring of counterpart funds during project preparation
            is essential to ensure they will be available during project
            implementation; (d) Early and effective integration of
            project activities to the mainstream implementing agency
            responsibilities and organization is essential to ensure
            project sustainability; (e) Ensuring ownership and
            commitment by decentralized agencies and local governments,
            who have the ultimate responsibility for implementing policy
            and project activities, is essential for achieving both,
            Development and Implementation objectives.
